# WDI 2022 Analysis

- Three indicators: **GDP per Capita**, **Life Expectancy**, **Inflation Rate**
- Data source: World Bank WDI [@wdi2022]; macro context: IMF WEO [@imf2022]

---

## Summary

- **GDP per Capita:** very large spread (~250 to ~226,000) → high inequality  
- **Life Expectancy:** mean ≈ 73, median ≈ 74 → concentrated in 70s  
- **Inflation:** mean ≈ 12%, std ≈ 19, max 171% → fat right tail / spikes

---

## GDP vs Life Expectancy


```{python}
#| echo: false
#| label: fig-gdp-life
#| fig-cap: "GDP per Capita vs Life Expectancy (WDI 2022). Source: World Bank [@wdi2022]."
#| fig-alt: "Scatter plot of GDP per Capita and Life Expectancy."

import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv("wdi.csv")
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

plt.figure()
plt.scatter(df["gdp_per_capita"], df["life_expectancy"], alpha=0.6)
plt.title("GDP per Capita vs Life Expectancy")
plt.xlabel("GDP per Capita")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy (years)")
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()
```

---

## Inflation Quantiles

```{python}
#| echo: false
#| label: fig-infl-quant
#| fig-cap: "Inflation Rate Quantiles (1%, 25%, 50%, 75%, 99%) from WDI 2022. Source: World Bank [@wdi2022]."
#| fig-alt: "Bar chart of inflation rate quantiles."
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

infl_quartiles = df["inflation_rate"].quantile([0.01, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 0.99])

plt.figure()
plt.bar(infl_quartiles.index.astype(str), infl_quartiles.values, edgecolor="black")
plt.title("Inflation Rate Quantiles")
plt.xlabel("Quantile")
plt.ylabel("Inflation Rate (%)")
plt.show()
```
